Posts.Content: Jan 1, 2013 01:12PM Lilyn wrote: Speedy the girls are all correct you cant worry about what you thought you might have done to bring this on. It is random no reason why some get this and some dont. My oncologist said at the beginning dont blame yourself. I think everyone here has great advice. Evergreen your recommendations are great. i wish I ate as healthy as that. I am trying but I am not big on veggies (which of course are so important). I drink green tea at least once a day and have definitely tried to cut back on sugar. I only have 1 or 2 glasses of wine a week now. I am four years out now and feeling good just want to work on my weight (blah) Happy Healthy New Year to All

Posts.Content: May 31, 2011 09:05PM Lilyn wrote: Yes I did have one year of Herceptin. Glad for that. actually have a six month checkup with my breast surgeon tomorrow and then in November will see the oncologist. Really enjoy how these appointments are being stretched out. I take Femara and that is it now for treatment. I actually had bilateral breast cancer, one tumour in one breast, two in the other and one little sucker was Her2 blah! I really enjoy this site so many interesting threads and lots of brave, strong and funny women. I really laugh a lot of some of their comments. We really give each other strength. xx
Posts.Title: CALLING ALL STAGE I SISTERS sheila888 MCBaker

Posts.Content: Oct 28, 2011 10:41PM - edited Oct 28, 2011 10:42PM by Lilyn Hi Michele I know it is very hard but your Mom is correct you have to wait and see. You mentioned that you didn't like the look of the lymph node on the U/S machine. It really is impossilble for us to decipher an US image unless your a imaging tech or radiologist I would think. Things always seemed to be strange looking on those screens my sister always did that,looked at the screen and terrified herself. Her biopsies have been negative. You will get the results and you and your doctor will know where to go from there, if it is benign they will tell you what folllow up is required, if it is not you will proceed with recommendations. Try to stay calm dear, I know NOT easy to do I know. sending you hugs and best wishes.
Posts.Title: brand new here and totally worried! Michele1975 Michele1975

Posts.Content: Mar 7, 2015 02:16PM Lilyn wrote: Hi Meme I know you cant even quite believe this is all happening. I remember my breast surgeon telling me I also knew it was coming. I ended up having bilateral breast cancer two tumours in one breast and one in the other. I am also triple positive and did chemo and a year of Herceptin. Wanted you to know that was in 2009. I look back now amazed at myself how I did it all, but you know what we do it. Chemo always seems such an awful thing but actually did not have much of a problem they give you all kinds of pill for nausea etc before. Hair loss is strange for sure, starts to slowly come out about two weeks after starting chemo, I just ended up getting it buzzed. I wore soft scarves and lots of very pretty earrings. It will seem like a long time coming back but slowly and surely it does. I used to get quite annoyed watching those commercials when shampoo models were swishing their long hair about. I wish you strength and love I know it is such a challenge but you will go step by step and in six years you will be looking back and writing to another women who is facing our journey xo Lois
Posts.Title: Overwhelming yet trying to be positive - a new reality Meme117 Trvler

Posts.Content: Mar 9, 2015 12:02AM Lilyn wrote: Hi meme think I got scarf at hospital shop they had a centre with wigs and accessories. I also had this wonderful short wig a bob so it came just below chin line but top was open net so not hot at all in summer just put baseball cap on and looked just like my hair on sides. So many things now u will venture through but we are all here every step of the way!

I really enjoy reading your posts and love love love your pictures. Take care Lois.
